BULLETIN Tropical Storm Otis Advisory Number 22 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP152017 800 PM PDT Sat Sep 16 2017
...OTIS BECOMING BETTER ORGANIZED...
SUMMARY OF 800 PM PDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...15.9N 127.3W ABOUT 1230 MI...1980 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...45 MPH...75 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 280 DEGREES AT 3 MPH...6 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 800 PM PDT (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Otis was located near latitude 15.9 North, longitude 127.3 West. Otis is moving toward the west near 3 mph (6 km/h). A slow northward movement is expected to begin overnight and continue through the next couple of days.
The estimated maximum sustained winds are near 45 mph (75 km/h) with higher gusts. Otis is forecast to strengthen slightly during the next 48 hours.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 200 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Zelinsky
